data.name: ADJT001
data.value: If you want the Adjust Op to be automatically solved by the calculator, set the "Simultaneous Adjust" property to "True". This way you won't need to open the Control Panel and your variable will be adjusted automatically whenever the flowsheet is calculated.

data.name: BENV001
data.value: If you want to add some experimental data to the diagram, enter the data in the corresponding table before requesting the calculation.

data.name: BENV002
data.value: The experimental data "y" column is used only in the xy diagrams. To show both experimental bubble and dew points in a T/P-xy diagram, enter all mole fractions in the "x" column.

data.name: BENV003
data.value: The experimental data can be copied and pasted directly from Microsoft Excel.

data.name: CAPE001
data.value: When running simulations containing CAPE-OPEN unit ops in another computer, make sure that these components are installed and registered properly on it.

data.name: CSTR001
data.value: Only kinetic type reactions will be considered by the CSTR.

data.name: CSUO001
data.value: To get help with scripts, take a look at the examples of Membrane and Hydrocyclone Unit Operations, located in the samples folder.

data.name: DCOL001
data.value: It is recommended that the column propertiy editing be carried out with the calculator disabled.

data.name: DCOL002
data.value: When editing the column connections, remember to click any cell other than the one being edited, so that changes are recognized by DWSIM.

data.name: DCOL003
data.value: Remember to set the pressure of the intermediate stages of the column.

data.name: FLSH001
data.value: Press F5 on any area inside the flowsheet to start a full calculation.

data.name: FLSH002
data.value: Use the quick connection tool on the toolbar to quickly connect objects by pressing the CTRL key and dragging the cursor from the first to the second object.

data.name: FLSH003
data.value: Hold SHIFT during DWSIM initialization to reset the settings to their default values.

data.name: FLSH004
data.value: See some specific help for the object being added by selecting it in the flowsheet and pressing the F1 key. This also works for Utilities.

data.name: FLSH005
data.value: To view detailed results of the calculations in real time, enable console redirection and select a debug mode. You must restart DWSIM for the changes to take effect.

data.name: FLSH006
data.value: Some object types display their main editing window when you do a double-click on them in the flowsheet.

data.name: FLSH007
data.value: After finishing updating the object connections, call the flowsheet solver by pressing the F5 key.

data.name: FOPT001
data.value: The optimizer window can also be freely repositioned just like the flowsheet sub-windows.

data.name: FSAN001
data.value: The sensitivity analysis tool window can also be freely repositioned.

data.name: MSTR001
data.value: You can edit the composition of a material stream through a double click with the left mouse button.

data.name: MSTR002
data.value: The material stream context menu offers some useful tools for managing its data, such as copying data from another stream, restoring original data, exporting the data to the clipboard, etc.

data.name: MSTR003
data.value: To prevent the composition edit window from showing after adding a material stream, hold the SHIFT key while dropping it in the flowsheet.

data.name: PENV001
data.value: When you request a calculation, all diagram types are calculated simultaneously. It isn't necessary to request another calculation if you want to see a different diagram on the screen.

data.name: PFR001
data.value: Only kinetic-type reactions will be taken into account by the PFR.

data.name: PURE001
data.value: The properties shown on this tool are for DWSIM compounds only. CAPE-OPEN compound properties are not displayed here.

data.name: RCON001
data.value: Only the conversion reactions will be considered by the conversion reactor.

data.name: RECY001
data.value: It is important to properly define the location of the Recycle in the flowsheet, to avoid unnecessary calculations. Insert it into the nearest point where the calculation flow returns to an already calculated point.

data.name: REQL001
data.value: The equilibrium reactor is used wherever the user has knowledge of the reactions that will occur. When that is not the case, use the Gibbs reactor.

data.name: RGIB001
data.value: The gibbs reactor is useful when there is no information about the reactions that may occur in the system. Remember that the mere fact that the results indicate that some kind of reaction will occur doesn't mean that this reaction will be spontaneous!
